name: 1,3-bis[tris(hydroxymethyl)methylamino]propane
Reason: 1,3-Bis[tris(hydroxymethyl)methylamino]propane has a melting point that we will compare to the base of n-hexane, which has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The presence of three tris(hydroxymethyl)methylamino groups introduces a significant increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around +60 degrees Celsius each. Additionally, the hydroxymethyl group introduces a hydrogen bonding potential, which can raise the melting point by approximately +10 degrees Celsius. The amino group also introduces a basic nitrogen, which can participate in hydrogen bonding, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The presence of two methyl groups reduces the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around -5 degrees Celsius each.
